question: Match List-I with List-II for the following reaction pattern: Glucose + Reagent -> Product

| List-I (Reagents) | List-II (Structural prediction) |
|---|---|
| a. Acetic anhydride | i. Glucose has an aldehyde group |
| b. Bromine water | ii. Glucose has a straight chain of six carbon atoms |
| c. Hydroiodic acid | iii. Glucose has five hydroxyl groups |
| d. Hydrogen cyanide | iv. Glucose has a carbonyl group |
explanation: Acetic anhydride reacts with OH groups -> confirms 5 OH groups (iii).
Bromine water oxidizes aldehyde -> confirms aldehyde group (i).
Hydroiodic acid reduces to n-hexane -> confirms straight chain (ii).
HCN forms cyanohydrin -> confirms carbonyl group (iv).
